verses.text: Be merciful unto me, O God: for man would swallow me up; He fighting daily oppresseth me.
Mine enemies would daily swallow \add me\add* up: For \add they be\add* many that fight against me, O thou \add most\add* High.
\add What\add* time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.
In God I will praise his word, In God I have put my trust; I will not fear What flesh can do unto me.
Every day they wrest my words: All their thoughts \add are\add* against me for evil.
They gather themselves together, they hide themselves, They mark my steps, When they wait for my soul.
\add Shall\add* they escape by iniquity? In \add thine\add* anger cast down the people, O God.
Thou tellest my wanderings: Put thou my tears into thy bottle: \add Are they\add* not in thy book?
When I cry \add unto thee\add*, then shall mine enemies turn back: This I know; for God \add is\add* for me.
In God will I praise \add his\add* word: In the \sc Lord\sc* will I praise \add his\add* word.
In God have I put my trust: I will not be afraid What man can do unto me.
Thy vows \add are\add* upon me, O God: I will render praises unto thee.
For thou hast delivered my soul from death: \add wilt\add* not \add thou deliver\add* my feet from falling, That \add I\add* may walk before God in the light of the living?
